postal_code_type = | postal_code = | area_code = | geocode = NP-FO | website = | footnotes = | government_type = Self governing province }} Gandaki Province (Nepali: गण्डकी प्रदेश [ɡʌɳɖʌki]), is one of the seven federal provinces of Nepal. It was established by the current constitution of Nepal. The province consists of 11 districts in total. ==Geography== Pokhara is the province's capital city. It borders the Tibet Autonomous Region of China to the north, Bagmati Province to the east, Karnali Province to the west, and Lumbini Province and Bihar of India to the south. The total area of the province is 21,504 km2 \- about 14.57% of the country's total area. ==Population== According to the 2011 census, the population of the province was 2,403,757. ==Politics== The newly elected Provincial Assembly adopted Gandaki Province as the permanent name by replacing its initial name Province no. 4 in July 2018. Krishna Chandra Nepali is the present chief minister of Gandaki Province. ==References== Category:Provinces of Nepal
